thread.title: Hakkari ekibinden ezici galibiyet
thread.title_full: Hakkari ekibinden ezici galibiyet

posts.title: Hakkari ekibinden ezici galibiyet
posts.text: Hakkari ekibinden ezici galibiyet 07 Kasım 2017 Salı, 12:17 Hakkari ekibinden ezici galibiyet (Fotoğraflı) Feyzullah Taş HAKKARİ (İHA) - Türkiye Bedensel Engelliler Spor Federasyonu Bölgesel Lig D Grubunda mücadele eden Hakkari Sümbül Engelliler Spor Kulübü Tekerlekli Sandalye Basketbol Takımı, deplasmanda Urfa Engelliler Basketbol Takımı ile oynadığı maçtan 91-10'luk skorla galip döndü. Geçen sezon Antalya'da gerçekleştirilen terfi müsabakalarına katılmayı hak kazanan Sümbül Engelliler Basketbol Takımı, bu yıl da gözünü play-off'a dikti. Kulüp Başkanı İlhan Ertuş, 2016-2017 sezonunda Antalya'da katıldıkları play-off müsabakalarını 7. sırada tamamladıklarını, bundan dolayı 2017-2018 sezonu için federasyon tarafından takımın 2. Lige davet edildiğini belirtti. Takımın hazırlıksız olmasından dolayı bu yıl bölgesel ligde devam etme kararı aldığını ifade eden Ertuş, "Kulübe maddi ve manevi desteklerini esirgemeyen başta Valimiz Cüneyit Orhan Toprak'a ve forma sponsoru Nibel İnşaat Firması sahibi Niyazi Ediş'e teşekkür ediyorum. Geçen yıl Hakkari'de gerçekleşen tüm müsabakalara halkımız yoğun ilgi gösterdi, bu yıl da halkımız tarafından aynı ilgi ve alakanın tribünlere yansıması beklentisi içerisindeyiz" şeklinde konuştu. (FT-MSA-Y)

thread.title: Man (22) arrested following death of Co Antrim man in Liverpool hit-and-run - The Irish News
thread.title_full: Man (22) arrested following death of Co Antrim man in Liverpool hit-and-run - The Irish News

posts.author: Suzanne Mcgonagle
posts.title: Man (22) arrested following death of Co Antrim man in Liverpool hit-and-run - The Irish News
posts.text:
Loughinisland Mr Bradley's girlfriend, Rihannon, expressed her devastation at his death on social media 
A 22-YEAR-OLD man was arrested in Liverpool yesterday over a hit-and-run that claimed the life of a Co Antrim man. 
Landscape gardener Matthew Bradley (24), who was originally from Glenavy, was attending a stag party in the city on Friday when he was struck by a car in The Strand area, close to the Albert Dock. 
He was taken to hospital shortly before midnight on Friday but died later. 
The vehicle was recovered in a residential area close to the scene a short time after the crash. 
Police said yesterday that a man from Vauxhall had been arrested on suspicion of causing death by dangerous driving. 
A spokeswoman for Merseyside Police said that the man was being interviewed. 
Family and friends of Mr Bradley have been paying tribute to the young man, who lived in Guildford in England with his girlfriend Rhiannon. 
She had written of her devastation on social media. 
"I am broken," she said. "You were my everything and I will always love you." 
His parents Donal and Margaret and sisters Claire, Roisin and Megan had also told of their heartache at his death, the second tragedy to hit the Bradley family. 
Matthew Bradley was originally from Glenavy 
Matthew's brother David died aged five when he was knocked down near his home in 1994. 
"Matthew was hugely talented and award-winning in his chosen career of landscaping gardening - following in his dad's footsteps - and had an illustrious career ahead of him"," the family said on Sunday. 
"He was a funny, kind-hearted and generous young man who will be sorely missed by all that I knew him." 
In a tribute yesterday, WorldSkills UK - an organisation helping young people further their careers - said Mr Bradley was a "fantastic ambassador". 
"We are greatly saddened to hear of the passing of Matthew Bradley who represented the UK in Landscape Gardening at WorldSkills Leipzig 2013," it said. 
"Matthew was fantastic ambassador for apprenticeships and skills and our thoughts are with his family and friends at this time." 
His cousin Marlene Ní Bhrolcháin also wrote that she was "heartbroken". 
"Matthew was a gentleman and we were so proud of him," she said. 
Another tribute said he was a "sweet, funny, talented" person.
